required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of the study is to compare the overall subjective preference between two Daily Disposable hydrogel lenses when refitted into a third hydrogel lens.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator)

primary_outcome.description: Participant's subjective response for lens preference of Pair-One at baseline visit, following insertion, after settling 10-15mins (surveyed at baseline visit) rated by questionnaire. (5 possible ratings: Strongly prefer left lens, Slightly prefer left lens, No preference, Slightly prefer right lens, Strongly prefer right lens).

primary_outcome.measure: Lens Preference - Pair-One (after 3 hours lens wear)
primary_outcome.description: Participant's subjective response for lens preference of Pair-One after 3 hours lens wear (surveyed at 3 hours after baseline visit) rated by questionnaire. (5 possible ratings: Strongly prefer left lens, Slightly prefer left lens, No preference, Slightly prefer right lens, Strongly prefer right lens).

Participant's subjective response for lens preference of Pair-Two after crossover, following insertion, after settling 10-15mins (3 hours after baseline visit) rated by questionnaire. (5 possible ratings: Strongly prefer left lens, Slightly prefer left lens, No preference, Slightly prefer right lens, Strongly prefer right lens).

primary_outcome.measure: Lens Preference - Pair-Two (after 3 hours lens wear)
primary_outcome.description: Participant's subjective response for lens preference of Pair-Two after crossover, following insertion, after settling 10-15mins (3 hours after baseline visit) rated by questionnaire. (5 possible ratings: Strongly prefer left lens, Slightly prefer left lens, No preference, Slightly prefer right lens, Strongly prefer right lens).

secondary_outcome.description: Participant's subjective response for lens comfort of Pair-One at baseline visit, following insertion, after settling 10-15mins (surveyed at baseline visit) rated by questionnaire. (0-100, 0= cannot be worn. Causes pain, 100= cannot be felt ever).

secondary_outcome.measure: Lens Comfort - Pair-One (after 3 hours lens wear)
secondary_outcome.description: Participant's subjective response for lens comfort of Pair-One after 3 hours lens wear (surveyed at 3 hours after baseline visit) rated by questionnaire. (0-100, 0= cannot be worn. Causes pain, 100= cannot be felt ever).

Participant's subjective response for lens comfort of Pair-Two after crossover, following insertion, after settling 10-15mins (3 hours after baseline visit) rated by questionnaire. (0-100, 0= cannot be worn. Causes pain, 100= cannot be felt ever).

secondary_outcome.measure: Lens Comfort - Pair-Two (after 3 hours lens wear)
secondary_outcome.description: Participant's subjective response for lens comfort of Pair-Two after 3 hours lens wear (surveyed at 6 hours after baseline visit) rated by questionnaire. (0-100, 0= cannot be worn. Causes pain, 100= cannot be felt ever).

secondary_outcome.measure: Lens Dryness - Pair-One (after 3 hours lens wear)
secondary_outcome.description: Participant's subjective response for lens dryness of Pair-One after 3 hours lens wear (surveyed at 3 hours after baseline visit) ) rated by questionnaire. (0-100, 0= cannot be worn. Extremely dry, 100= no dryness experienced).

secondary_outcome.measure: Lens Dryness - Pair-Two (after 3 hours lens wear)
secondary_outcome.description: Participant's subjective response for lens dryness of Pair-Two after 3 hours lens wear (surveyed at 6 hours after baseline visit) ) rated by questionnaire. (0-100, 0= cannot be worn. Extremely dry, 100= no dryness experienced).

Participant's subjective response for lens handling of Pair-One following insertion (surveyed at baseline visit) rated by questionnaire. (0-100, 0= very hard to handle. Causes pain, 100= very easy to handle).

Participant's subjective response for lens handling of Pair-Two after crossover, following insertion (surveyed at 3 hours after baseline visit) rated by questionnaire. (0-100, 0= very hard to handle. Causes pain, 100= very easy to handle).
The ophthalmologist's objective assessment for lens wettability of Pair-One following insertion (assessed at baseline visit) by biomicroscopy. (0-4, 0.25 steps, 0=excellent, 4 severely reduced).

The ophthalmologist's objective assessment for lens wettability of Pair-Two after crossover, following insertion (assessed at 3 hours after baseline visit) by biomicroscopy. (0-4, 0.25 steps, 0=excellent, 4 severely reduced).
The ophthalmologist's objective assessment for lens fit for centration of Pair-One following insertion (assessed at baseline visit) by biomicroscopy. (Optimum or Decentered N T S I).

secondary_outcome.measure: Lens Fit, Post-Blink Movement - Pair-One (after insertion)
secondary_outcome.description: The ophthalmologist's objective assessment for lens fit for Post-Blink Movement of Pair-One following insertion (assessed at baseline visit) by biomicroscopy. (mm, 0.1 Steps, Primary Gaze).

The ophthalmologist's objective assessment for lens fit for Tightness of Pair-One following insertion (assessed at baseline visit) by biomicroscopy. (%, 5 Steps, 0-100, 0=extremely loose, 100=extremely tight).

The ophthalmologist's objective assessment for lens fit for centration of Pair-Two after crossover, following insertion (assessed at 3 hours after baseline visit) by biomicroscopy. (Optimum or Decentered N T S I).

secondary_outcome.measure: Lens Fit, Post-Blink Movement - Pair-Two (after insertion)
secondary_outcome.description: The ophthalmologist's objective assessment for lens fit for Post-Blink Movement of Pair-Two after crossover, following insertion (assessed at 3 hours after baseline visit) by biomicroscopy. (mm, 0.1 Steps, Primary Gaze).

The ophthalmologist's objective assessment for lens fit for Tightness of Pair-Two after crossover, following insertion (assessed at 3 hours after baseline visit) by biomicroscopy. (%, 5 Steps, 0-100, 0=extremely loose, 100=extremely tight).

The ophthalmologist's objective assessment for lens surface deposition of Pair-One following insertion (assessed at baseline visit) by biomicroscopy. (0-4, 0.25 steps, 0=excellent, 4 severely reduced).

The ophthalmologist's objective assessment for lens surface deposition of Pair-Two after crossover, following insertion (assessed at 3 hours after baseline visit) by biomicroscopy. (0-4, 0.25 steps, 0=excellent, 4 severely reduced).

secondary_outcome.measure: High Contrast Visual Acuity - Habitual Lenses
secondary_outcome.description: The ophthalmologist's objective assessment of High Contrast Visual Acuity measured at screening with habitual lenses by computerized charts. (Positive logMAR values indicate poorer vision, negative values denote better vision than baseline 20/20 value)

The ophthalmologist's objective assessment of High Contrast Visual Acuity following Pair-One insertion (assessed at baseline visit) by computerized charts. (Positive logMAR values indicate poorer vision, negative values denote better vision than baseline 20/20 value)

The ophthalmologist's objective assessment of High Contrast Visual Acuity after crossover, following Pair-Two insertion (assessed at 3 hours after baseline visit) by computerized charts and reported. (Positive logMAR values indicate poorer vision, negative values denote better vision than baseline 20/20 value)

secondary_outcome.measure: Ocular Health, Corneal Staining - Baseline Screening (Before lens insertion)
secondary_outcome.description: The ophthalmologist's objective assessment of corneal staining assessed at screening (before lens insertion of Pair-One) by biomicroscopy. (0-100, 0=none, 4=patch).

secondary_outcome.measure: Ocular Health, Corneal Staining - Pair-One (after removal)
secondary_outcome.description: The ophthalmologist's objective assessment of corneal staining assessed after removal of Pair-One (worn 3 hours, but before lens insertion of Pair-Two) by biomicroscopy. (0-100, 0=none, 4=patch).

secondary_outcome.measure: Ocular Health, Corneal Staining - Pair-Two (after removal)
secondary_outcome.description: The ophthalmologist's objective assessment of corneal staining assessed after removal of Pair-Two (worn 3 hours) by biomicroscopy. (0-100, 0=none, 4=patch).

secondary_outcome.measure: Ocular Health, Conjunctival Hyperemia- Baseline Screening (Before lens insertion)
secondary_outcome.description: The ophthalmologist's objective assessment of conjunctival bulbar and limbal hyperemia assessed at screening (before lens insertion of Pair-One) by biomicroscopy. (0-4, 0.5 steps, Institute for Eye Research scale (IER), CL on eye).

secondary_outcome.measure: Ocular Health, Conjunctival Hyperemia- Pair-One (after removal)
secondary_outcome.description: The ophthalmologist's objective assessment of conjunctival bulbar and limbal hyperemia assessed after removal of Pair-One (worn 3 hours, but before lens insertion of Pair-Two) by biomicroscopy. (0-4, 0.5 steps, Institute for Eye Research scale (IER), CL on eye).

secondary_outcome.measure: Ocular Health, Conjunctival Hyperemia- Pair-Two (after removal)
secondary_outcome.description: The ophthalmologist's objective assessment of conjunctival bulbar and limbal hyperemia assessed after removal of Pair-Two (worn 3 hours) by biomicroscopy. (0-4, 0.5 steps, Institute for Eye Research scale (IER), CL on eye).

arm_group.description: Participants wear one of their habitual brand lenses in one eye (comparator) and one lens of test lens in the other.
Participants wear one of their habitual brand lenses in one eye (comparator) and one lens of test lens in the other.

intervention.description: Participants wear one of their habitual brand lenses in one eye (comparator) and one lens of test lens in the other.
Participants wear one of their habitual brand lenses in one eye (comparator) and one lens of test lens in the other.
Participants wear one of their habitual brand lenses in one eye (comparator) and one lens of test lens in the other.
